channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Silver Is So Pricey That the World’s Largest Jeweler Is Switching to Platinum
item.description: Pandora, known for its charm bracelets, is trying to reduce its exposure to the volatility in silver prices, the latest setback for a company also fac...

item.title: This Gen Z woman applied for 1,000 jobs and offered to cut her own pay because she was ‘really broke and struggling.’ She’s not alone
item.description: Taking a pay cut at the beginning of your career can have long-term consequences.

item.title: Major Nuclear Arms Treaty Expires, and Federal Prosecutor in Minnesota Says ‘This Job Sucks’
item.description: Plus, Savannah Guthrie makes a plea to her mother’s abductor.

item.title: The ‘dumb money’ steps in as traders lose $1 trillion on the realization that AI will eat tech companies first
item.description: The chaos is mostly a tech-stock phenomenon. The equal-weight S&P 500 is actually at a record high.

item.title: Quick End to Second Day of Russia-Ukraine Peace Talks Hints at Impasse
item.description: American negotiators trumpeted plans for a prisoner swap, but that was small recompense for months of diplomatic efforts by the Trump administration.

item.title: Developer Hongkong Land launches a $6.5B Singapore real estate fund, the country’s largest, as part of CEO Michael Smith’s strategic pivot
item.description: The new fund has the Qatar Investment Authority as a key investor, as Hongkong Land focuses on commercial property and slims its residential business.

item.title: He Was Laid Off at The Washington Post After Working There 60 Years
item.description: Martin Weil, one of hundreds being let go at The Post, has worked on local news there since 1965, witnessing the paper’s rise and now retrenchment.

item.title: Less than 10% of employees believe their bosses are demonstrating moral leadership
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: The 2026 private equity outlook appears hazy, says PitchBook
item.description: PitchBook data shows private equity exit value surged, even as fundraising struggled.

item.title: Israel Launches Deadly Strikes on Gaza, Saying Militants Attacked Its Soldiers
item.description: Gaza officials said the Israeli airstrikes killed at least 21 Palestinians. Israel said one of its soldiers was critically wounded in the attack by Pa...

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel Hints ‘Melania’ Box Office Was a ‘Rigged Outcome’
item.description: Late night hosts were skeptical of a $7 million opening weekend for the new Amazon film about the first lady.

item.title: 36 Hours in Lagos, Nigeria: Things to Do and See
item.description: Nigeria’s mega metropolis is gaining attention for its youth culture and Afrobeats music scene.

item.title: Quick End to Second Day of Russia-Ukraine Peace Talks Hints at Impasse
item.description: American negotiators trumpeted plans for a prisoner swap, but that was small recompense for months of diplomatic efforts by the Trump administration.

item.title: Jessie Diggins is the Olympian Testing the Limits of Endurance
item.description: Jessie Diggins has become the best-ever American cross-country skier because of what she pushes her body through.

item.title: ‘It’s Collective Punishment’: Iran Exacts Heavy Price on Protest Supporters
item.description: The authorities are making mass arrests, seizing assets and hunting down doctors who treated protesters. Some Iranians keep showing defiance anyway.
